0.title: Mulayam Singh's mortal remains reach his ancestral village Saifai in UP
0.article_body: The mortal remains of Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav reached his ancestral village Saifai on Monday evening. His last rites will be held on Tuesday. A convoy of 300 vehicles carried his body to Saifai from Gurugram's Medanta Hospital, where he passed away on Monday after a prolonged illness.

1.title: Strikes hit building that houses visa office in Kyiv: Germany
1.article_body: A building that houses the visa office of the German embassy in Kyiv was hit during Russian strikes on the city during Monday's rush hours, the German foreign ministry informed. It added that the office has not been used since the onset of the war in Ukraine. "Our colleagues at the Embassy in Kyiv are well," the foreign ministry stated.

2.title: Adani Group in talks to raise $10 billion for expansion plans: Report
2.article_body: Gautam Adani and his family have reportedly held talks with investors, including Singapore investment firms Temasek and GIC, to raise at least $10 billion to fund its expansion into clean energy, ports and cement businesses. Gautam Adani had previously said that Adani Group will invest over $100 billion over the next decade, most of it in the energy transition business.

3.title: Voice of socialist ideas fallen silent with Mulayam Singh's demise: Sonia
3.article_body: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Monday condoled the demise of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. She said the voice of socialist ideas has fallen silent with his demise. Yadav, the three-time former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister, passed away at the age of 82 at Medanta Hospital in Haryana's Gurugram on Monday.

4.title: Blackmailed with private video, 22-yr-old dies by suicide in Pune
4.article_body: A 22-year-old student died by suicide after he was blackmailed by an online fraudster who threatened to upload his private video on social media, officers said. The accused pretended to be a woman and shot an obscene video, following which he demanded money for not uploading it on social media platforms, said Assistant Police Inspector Berad.

5.title: Pathetic, in one word this is cheating: Venkatesh on video of Wade pushing Mark Wood
5.article_body: Reacting to Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade pushing England pacer Mark Wood while the latter was going for a catch, ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad tweeted, "Pathetic, in one word this is cheating, not in the spirit of the game." He added, "The sense of entitlement of these guys is unbelievable. Bulls****ing about spirit of the game when there is no spirit."

6.title: Initially, I was entertained: Radhika on rumours of her dating Tusshar Kapoor
6.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has revealed that those handling the promotions of her film 'Shor in the City' were responsible for the rumours about her dating co-star Tusshar Kapoor. "Initially, I was very entertained, because I got an article that I was apparently in Goa celebrating Valentine's Day with Tusshar and I was studying for my exams in London," she added.

7.title: Mulayam was deeply committed to socialist political traditions: Deve Gowda
7.article_body: Former PM HD Deve Gowda said that ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav was "deeply committed to the secular and socialist political traditions". Mulayam (82) died on Monday at a private hospital in Gurugram after a prolonged illness. Gowda's JD(S) and Mulayam's SP were formed after breaking out from the erstwhile Janata Dal (People's Party).

8.title: Large Indian traders avoid rupee trade with Russia due to sanction fears: Report
8.article_body: Large Indian lenders are reportedly reluctant to process direct rupee trade transactions with Russia due to fears of being targeted by sanctions by the US and Europe. Banks like State Bank of India and Punjab National Bank were among the lenders, according to sources. Two smaller lenders have moved to adopt a mechanism to settle trade with Russia in rupees.

9.title: 4 arrested for plotting to kill Uttarakhand Minister Saurabh Bahuguna
9.article_body: Four people have been arrested for allegedly planning to kill Uttarakhand Cabinet Minister Saurabh Bahuguna. Police said the conspiracy was hatched by a man jailed in Haldwani prison. He held the minister responsible for his imprisonment and was in contact with some shooters from Uttar Pradesh to execute the plan.

10.title: TCS adds 35,000 freshers in the first half of FY23, says 'all job offers honoured'
10.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) onboarded 35,000 freshers during the first half of FY23 and 20,000 of these were onboarded in Q2 itself, the company said on Monday. In comparison, the company hired 43,000 freshers in the first half of FY22. TCS' Chief HR Officer Milind Lakkad said that TCS has honoured all job offers the company had made.

11.title: 23-yr-old tries to steal Ex-Maha CM's phone from Mumbai-bound train; arrested
11.article_body: A 23-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly trying to steal the phone of former Maharashtra CM Sushil Kumar Shinde, who was travelling by train from his hometown of Solapur to Mumbai. Shinde's daughter caught the accused red-handed when the former Minister had gone to the toilet, reports said. The accused was caught and handed over to the GRP.

12.title: Freedom being misused: India on Khalistani activity in Canada
12.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said that India has flagged issues related to Khalistani forces operating out of Canada. Jaishankar said, "We have flagged the need to ensure that freedoms in a democratic society are not misused by forces which actually advocate violence and bigotry." The minister reminded Canada of the "responsibility that democracies have to other democracies".

13.title: Ready to step up aid to Kyiv, France says after latest Russian strikes
13.article_body: In a call with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy, French President Emmanuel Macron expressed France's commitment to step up military aid for Ukraine's war efforts against Russia, the Elysee said. The call took place after Russia reportedly struck multiple Ukrainian cities during rush hour on Monday. This came following an explosion on a bridge that connects mainland Russia to Crimea.

14.title: Snapchat launches 'Family Centre' feature for parental controls in India
14.article_body: Snapchat has rolled out parental controls in India in the form of in-app tool called 'Family Centre'. These controls will allow parents of children between 13-18 years of age to see who they are friends with and who they have messaged without revealing the content of the messages. Parents can confidentially report suspicious accounts on 'Family Centre', the company said.

15.title: Student boarding BMTC bus injured after being crushed under its rear wheel
15.article_body: A 23-year-old post-graduate student sustained grievous injuries after she slipped while boarding a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) bus and was crushed under one of its rear wheels near the Jnana Bharathi campus of Bangalore University. Students at the university held a protest over the driver's alleged carelessness. The driver has been arrested and the bus has been impounded.

16.title: PMC blacklists 13 contractors over poor quality of roads in Pune
16.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has blacklisted 13 contractors for carrying out poor quality work and fined seven deputy engineers of the road department over poor condition of roads in Pune. The contractors and engineers have been fined ₹5,000 and ₹15,000, respectively. This comes after PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar inspected the bad condition of the roads after receiving complaints from people.

17.title: Violence reported between 2 communities in Kolkata; Section 144 imposed
17.article_body: A clash broke out between two communities at Mominpur in Kolkata on the night of October 8 over Milad-un-Nabi flags. Many houses in the Mayurbhanj area were ransacked and cars were destroyed the next day. Prohibitory orders under Section 144 have been imposed in the Ekbalpur area till October 12 in view of the law and order situation.

18.title: Not right to pit films against each other: Vikram Vedha directors on 'Ponniyin...'
18.article_body: Director duo Pushkar and Gayathri said the release of 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' has not affected the box office collection of their film 'Vikram Vedha'. "I don't think the presence of another big film is going to hurt either one of the movies majorly...it's not right to pit movies against each other," they added. Both films had released on September 30.

19.title: Name of Shinde & his MLAs will be written in ‘black ink’: Sena
19.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, in an editorial in its mouthpiece 'Samaana', said that the name of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and his MLAs will be written in "black ink". Shiv Sena on Monday said that it is a bushfire that can never be extinguished and promised to bounce back from EC's decision to freeze the party's name and symbol.

20.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 with over 2,600 kg of illegal crackers
20.article_body: Delhi Police's Crime Branch has arrested two men and seized 2,625 kg of illegal firecrackers from their possession, which were to be sold during the upcoming festival season, officials said on Monday. Police said that one of the accused had been in the firecrackers business since 2018, while the other had been working since 2020 and got paid ₹12,000.

21.title: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin asks Centre to treat all languages equally
21.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin warned the Centre against the imposition of the Hindi language and asked the government to treat all languages equally. "India has unity in diversity...We should come to a level where all languages are official languages...We urge the Prime Minister and government to stop Hindi imposition and save India's unity," said Stalin.

22.title: Sanjay Raut's custody extended till October 17 in land scam case
22.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's judicial custody has been extended till October 17 in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. He was arrested by the ED on August 1 after over six hours of questioning in the ₹1,034-crore case. Earlier in August, Raut’s wife was also questioned by the probe agency in connection with the same case.

23.title: Dharmendra shares pic from 'Sholay', calls Big B 'most talented actor'
23.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra Deol took to Twitter and shared an old picture with actor Amitabh Bachchan from 'Sholay'. "I got news from Rajshri Productions that you're doing a film ('Uunchai') with them...Most talented actor and the best production house together," Dharmendra tweeted along with the photo. Dharmendra further wished Amitabh for 'Uunchai', which is directed by Sooraj Barjatya.

24.title: Iranian drones used in Russia's attack on Ukraine: Zelenskyy
24.article_body: After Russia bombed multiple Ukrainian cities on Monday, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that dozens of missiles and Iranian drones were used in the attack which targeted civilians and energy facilities. The timing and goals of the explosions "were specially chosen to cause as much damage as possible", he added. He also urged people to stay in shelters today.

25.title: It takes two to tango: Shreyas to Ishan who missed his ton in India's win vs SA
25.article_body: Reacting to Ishan Kishan expressing disappointment for not scoring a hundred in the second South Africa ODI, Shreyas Iyer praised the 24-year-old and said, "We won the match...it takes two to tango, you'll get one in the next game." Ishan had said, "What do you have to say about scoring a hundred, meanwhile I missed [mine] at my home ground."

26.title: Tabu, Kriti Sanon joins Kareena in Rhea Kapoor's comedy film: Report
26.article_body: Tabu and Kriti Sanon will reportedly share screen space with Kareena Kapoor Khan in Rhea Kapoor's upcoming comedy film. The project will mark Kareena's first collaboration with Kriti and Tabu. Talking about the movie, Kareena had previously shared that she's "super excited" about the film, which she said is "slightly different" than Rhea's previous production venture, 'Veere Di Wedding'.

27.title: Sajid flashed his private part at me, asked me to rate it on 0 to 10 scale: Sherlyn Chopra
27.article_body: Actress Sherlyn Chopra took to Twitter and alleged that filmmaker Sajid Khan had flashed his "private part" at her and asked her to rate it on a scale of 0 to 10. She added, "I’d like to enter into the house of Big Boss and give him the rating! Let India watch how a survivor deals with her molester!"

28.title: School manager in UP sends obscene messages, pics to woman; booked
28.article_body: An FIR has been registered against the manager of a private school in UP for allegedly sending obscene photographs and messages to a woman, police said on Sunday. The woman's father alleged that the accused sent obscene photographs and messages on her daughter's phone on October 5, said Manoj Kumar Singh, Station House Officer, Ujhani.

29.title: Armed confrontation is not an option: Taiwanese Prez to China
29.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Monday said that she wants to "make it clear" to authorities in China that "armed confrontation is absolutely not an option". She also said that it's "regrettable" that China has escalated military tensions and threatened the peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait and the region. Ing-wen made the remarks during her National Day address.

30.title: Apple iPhone 5c to be added to obsolete product list on Nov 1: Report
30.article_body: Apple iPhone 5c will be added to the obsolete product list on November 1, resulting in discontinuation of all service programs for the model, according to reports. The firm sent a memo to authorised Apple resellers mentioning the same. Apple's memo also states that the third-generation iPad mini with Wi-Fi and TD-LTE will also be marked 'obsolete' on November 1.

31.title: Video shows journalist ducking for cover live on air as missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv
31.article_body: A video showing the moment a BBC journalist ducked for cover during a live broadcast which was interrupted as Russian missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv on Monday, has gone viral. The reporter, Hugo Bachega, could be seen rushing to take shelter after hearing the sound of a missile overhead. BBC said it re-established contact with the journalist over an hour later.

32.title: Would die on spot if I ever encounter a ghost: Katrina Kaif
32.article_body: Katrina Kaif said she "would die on the spot" if she'd ever encounter a ghost in real life. Katrina plays a ghost in 'Phone Bhoot', which also stars Ishaan Khatter and Siddhant Chaturvedi. When asked who'd she haunt if she was a ghost for a day, Katrina said she'd haunt Priyanka Chopra "to see how she does so much work".

33.title: Delhi reports more than 300 cases of Dengue in first 5 days of Oct
33.article_body: Delhi has reported a rise in dengue cases as 321 people were diagnosed with the infection in the first five days of October, data showed. Delhi reported 693 dengue cases in the month of September, taking the national capital's total tally to 1,258 so far this year. However, no dengue-related deaths have been reported in Delhi this year till now.

34.title: ED moves SC against HC order quashing probe against Indiabulls
34.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has moved the Supreme Court (SC) to challenge the Delhi High Court's (HC) order quashing a probe against home finance firm Indiabulls. According to ED, Indiabulls loaned money to entities to increase its stocks' market price. The Delhi HC had quashed the ED probe against Indiabulls and held that no coercive action be taken against the firm.

35.title: Manmohan Singh writes condolence letter to Akhilesh on Mulayam Singh's demise
35.article_body: Former PM Manmohan Singh wrote condolence letter to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on demise of his father Mulayam Singh Yadav. In the letter, Singh wrote, "He was a leader of high esteem who was respected by everybody irrespective of party lines." "My wife joins me to convey to you and other members of your family our deepest condolences," he added.

36.title: Mulayam Singh used to respect all religions, fight for them: Farooq Abdullah
36.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party founder and ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav, National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah said he was a people's leader. "He used to respect all religions and fight for them. There's no person in India who wouldn't be grieved on this day," Abdullah added. "He devoted all his life for the welfare of poor," he stated.

37.title: PM lays foundation stone for projects worth ₹8,000 crore in Gujarat
37.article_body: PM Modi laid the foundation stone of various development projects in Gujarat worth over ₹8,000 crore and lauded the progress of the Bharuch region over the years. "Once Bharuch was known only for salted peanuts, today it is flourishing in industry and trade," said the PM. He also praised the setting up of the first drug park in Bharuch.

38.title: Troll says 'RRR' will win Oscar for 'best cringe movie', Vishnu Manchu reacts
38.article_body: Actor Vishnu Manchu, known for his work in Telugu cinema and television, has responded to a Twitter user who wrote, "Is there any category called best cringe movie? If yes then definitely 'RRR' will win Oscar in that category." "Why don't we celebrate Indian cinema my brother? Now it ain't about regional pride but national pride," Vishnu wrote.

39.title: 26-yr-old autorickshaw driver stabbed in Pune, 3 friends arrested
39.article_body: Hours after a 26-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was found murdered in Pune, police on Saturday arrested three of his friends for allegedly stabbing him to death following a dispute. Senior Inspector Abhay Mahajan said the deceased had used insulting words towards the accused in an inebriated condition, following which they stabbed him to death.

40.title: Death toll from boat capsize in Nigeria rises to 76
40.article_body: The death toll from a boat tragedy in Nigeria's Anambra state has risen to 76, the country's President Muhammadu Buhari said on Sunday. The boat capsized on Friday amid heavy flooding in the Ogbaru area of Anambra, as per local authorities. Earlier on Saturday, authorities had reported 10 people dead and 60 others missing.

41.title: Apple AirPods to be manufactured in India, says IT Ministry: Report
41.article_body: Apple's AirPods will be manufactured in India, said a report quoting IT Ministry. This comes after Apple announced its plans to start manufacturing iPhone 14 in India. As per the report, the iPhone 14 will be manufactured by December 2022 at Foxconn's facility near Chennai. The company is already manufacturing iPhone 13 in India.

42.title: Filmmaker Karan Johar quits Twitter, deletes his account
42.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar today deleted his Twitter account after announcing he's quitting the platform. In a tweet posted at 3 pm, he wrote, "Making space for more positive energies only and this is step one towards that...Goodbye Twitter!" Reacting to his decision, a Twitter user wrote, "Please stay...Karan." Another tweet read, "Focus on your mental health and 'Brahmastra 2'...Sending positivity."

43.title: We are not in Premier League title race: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp
43.article_body: After their 2-3 defeat against Arsenal in the Premier League on Sunday, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said that they are not in the race for the Premier League title anymore. "We have problems at the moment," admitted Klopp after the match. Liverpool are currently placed 10th on the points table, with two wins from eight matches so far.

44.title: RBI sells dollars as rupee hits record low on fears of US rate hike: Report
44.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India have reportedly sold dollars via state-run banks on Monday after Rupee fell to a record low of 82.6825. The fall came following a US jobs report that suggested more aggressive rate hikes. "The RBI activity, in our opinion, is not more aggressive than in recent days," a spot dealer at a private sector bank said.

45.title: 300-vehicle convoy carries Mulayam's body to his native place in UP; video surfaces
45.article_body: A convoy of 300 vehicles carried the body of SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav to his native place in Uttar Pradesh's Saifai. A video that has surfaced on social media showed the convoy passing through the Yamuna Expressway, while people were seen showering flowers on some of the cars. Mulayam Singh Yadav passed away on Monday after a prolonged illness.

46.title: Big B's fans dance to 'Don' song in theatre, Shabana shares video
46.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi has shared a video showing people dancing to the title song of Amitabh Bachchan's 1978 film 'Don' in a Mumbai theatre. The film was screened on Saturday as a part of 'Bachchan Back To The Beginning', a film festival organised by Film Heritage Foundation and PVR Cinemas to celebrate Amitabh's 80th birthday. "What a treat," Shabana wrote.

47.title: Russian troops advancing towards Ukrainian town of Bakhmut: UK
47.article_body: Russian forces are advancing towards Bakhmut, which is considered a strategically important town in eastern Ukraine, a British intelligence update said on Monday. Russian troops have come 2 km closer to the town in the last week, the communique added. Bakhmut sits on the main road leading to the cities of Sloviansk and Kramatorsk in the Donbas region.

48.title: Villagers in Saifai recall locals skipping meal in 1967 for Mulayam Singh
48.article_body: People of Saifai, which is the native village of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, recalled incident of 1967 Assembly elections, on his demise. Sharing the incident, they said that a meeting of the entire village was called and it was decided that they will skip one meal a day to ensure that Yadav's car can run for eight days.

49.title: CCTV video shows UP policeman stealing sleeping man's phone, police respond
49.article_body: A CCTV video has surfaced showing a police constable stealing the phone of a man sleeping on a cot by the roadside during his night patrol in UP's Kanpur. Reacting to the video, Additional Superintendent of Police, Kanpur Outer, said that the accused constable Prigesh Kumar has been suspended. Police said that prima facie the allegation appears to be true.

50.title: 'Netaji' was an emotion for people of UP: Kumar Vishvas on Mulayam Singh’s demise
50.article_body: Poet Dr Kumar Vishvas expressed grief on the demise of Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav. "You may agree or disagree with his political decisions but for us, people of UP, he wasn't a person but an emotion," Vishvas tweeted. "An era of understanding of land and people...has ended," he added.

51.title: Ukraine conflict does not serve interests of anybody: Jaishankar
51.article_body: On being questioned about the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said, "We believe that this conflict does not serve the interests of anybody, neither the participants nor indeed of the international community." He also declined to predict if India will support or abstain from a draft resolution against Russia in UN General Assembly.

52.title: Reliance, Jio aim to raise $1.5 billion and $2.5 billion, respectively: Report
52.article_body: Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) and Jio are in talks with lenders to raise up to $1.5 and $2.5 billion, respectively in foreign loans, Economic Times reported. RIL will reportedly raise funds to support its capital expenditure plan. Jio is in talks with Bank of America, BNP, HSBC, and Societe Generale to purchase 5G network gear from Ericsson and Nokia.

53.title: Delhi Police integrate its licensing services with DigiLocker
53.article_body: Delhi Police has integrated its licensing services with DigiLocker. With this, citizens will be able to keep their licences, including arms, eating and lodging house licence, in digital form in the DigiLocker app from now on, said Sanjay Singh, Special Commissioner (Licensing and Legal Division). "Enforcing agencies too will have an authentic source for verification of such licenses," he added.

54.title: 2 arrested for cheating hotel management students in Pune
54.article_body: The Pune Police arrested two people for allegedly defrauding students of hotel management on fake assurances of employment at hotels in foreign countries. According to the police, the two accused were running a private career consultancy service and allegedly took ₹4.5 lakh from the complainant on the pretext of providing the assured job.

55.title: Gurugram Police arrest 2 men for assaulting cops, hospital staff
55.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested two men from Delhi for allegedly assaulting policemen and hospital staffers in Sohna last week. The suspects, Manish (27) and Sandeep (25), allegedly assaulted employees at a private hospital and later attacked policemen who came to the staffers' rescue. There are already three cases registered against Manish for snatching and possession of illegal weapons, police said.

56.title: I think 2022 T20 WC final would be between WI and Australia: Chris Gayle
56.article_body: Veteran West Indies cricketer Chris Gayle has said the final of the upcoming T20 WC could be played between West Indies and Australia. Gayle, however, also added that it'll be difficult for West Indies as there's "no Kieron Pollard, Andre Russell and Bravo in the team". "It's just a matter of adapting your strategy in the right way," stated Gayle.

57.title: Urban naxals trying to enter Guj, state will destroy them: PM Modi
57.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that "urban naxals" were trying to gain entry into Gujarat by changing their appearance but the state will not allow them to "destroy the lives of youth". "They have changed their costumes. They are misleading our innocent and energetic youth into following them," PM Modi added. "Gujarat will destroy them," he stated.

58.title: Doctor harasses 19-yr-old B'luru student; teams formed to nab him
58.article_body: Special teams have been formed to apprehend a doctor who allegedly sexually harassed a 19-year-old student when she visited his clinic in Bengaluru's Chandra Layout in last week of September and first week of October. She accused the doctor touched her inappropriately. The matter came to light when the student's mother asked her to consult the doctor and she refused.

59.title: Tata Motors shares fall 4.6% after fall in Jaguar Land Rover wholesale volumes
59.article_body: Shares of Tata Motors fell by 4.6% on Monday after Tata revealed that its Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) business wholesale volumes fell below expectations. JLR wholesale volumes were 75,307 for the second quarter against the projected volumes of 90,000. The automaker blamed lower-than-expected supply of specialised semiconductor chips from one supplier for failing to meet its target.

60.title: Ben Bernanke, Douglas Diamond and Philip Dybvig awarded 2022 Nobel Prize in Economics
60.article_body: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences has awarded 2022 Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel to Ben S Bernanke, Douglas W Diamond and Philip H Dybvig. They have been given the award "for research on banks and financial crises". A prize money of 10 million Swedish kronor (₹7.29 crore) will be shared among the trio.

61.title: Uddhav-led Sena will 'rise like phoenix' after present turmoil: MLA
61.article_body: MLA Bhaskar Yadav of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena said that the present turmoil in the party is just a passing phase and expressed confidence that Sena will "rise again like a phoenix". Shiv Sena deputy leader Sushma Andhare claimed that CM Shinde was just a puppet in the hands of the BJP.

62.title: Pune University students protest against 'excessive' fee hike
62.article_body: Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has increased fees for various courses, leading to protests by several student organisations. Principal Dr Rajendra Zunjarrao said the students are comparing this year's fees to last year's when the college had decreased the actual fees due to the pandemic. The students are demanding a rollback of the "excessive" fee hike.

63.title: Shreyas has been magnificent, you might see him in that XI for ODI WC: Jaffer
63.article_body: Ex-cricketer Wasim Jaffer has praised batter Shreyas Iyer for his performance in recent ODIs, stating that the 27-year-old might "squeeze in" somewhere in India's playing XI for the 2023 ODI World Cup. "Shreyas has been magnificent. In his last six ODI innings, he has got four fifties and one hundred," added Jaffer. Shreyas slammed 113*(111) in the second SA ODI.

64.title: I change approach based on instinct, not the bowler: Shreyas on 113*
64.article_body: Discussing his unbeaten 113 off 111 balls in the second ODI against South Africa, Team India batter Shreyas Iyer said, "I am not someone who changes according to the bowler. I...change [based] on [my] instinct." "It's not something I try in [the] nets first, I change it in the match itself," added Shreyas. Shreyas' unbeaten 113 comprised 15 fours.

65.title: SP worker breaks down over Mulayam Singh's death, video surfaces
65.article_body: A Samajwadi Party worker broke down after the demise of party's founder Mulayam Singh Yadav on Monday. A video of him breaking down outside Gurugram's Medanta hospital, where Yadav passed away aged 82, has surfaced online. In the video, he could be seen crying inconsolably and saying, "We were praying...for Netaji's health. This news (of his demise) is very sad."

66.title: 'Is this court's job?': Supreme Court on plea to declare cow as national animal
66.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to entertain a plea that sought the court direct the government to declare cow as a national animal. A bench of Justices SK Kaul and Abhay S Oka asked the petitioner, "Is this the job of the court? Which fundamental right is violated?" The plea was withdrawn after the court warned of imposing costs.

67.title: India's Oscar entry 'Chhello Show' tickets to be sold for ₹95
67.article_body: India's official Oscar entry 'Chhello Show' will be screened a day early than its official release date in 95 theaters, with tickets priced at ₹95. Confirming the news, director Pan Nalin said, "What better way to celebrate its ['Chhello Show'] selection at the 95th Oscars than by releasing it in 95 cinemas at a wonderful price of ₹95."

68.title: Shinde submits 'Talwar' & 'Gada' as choices after EC freezes Sena symbol
68.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena submitted 'Tutari' (trumpet), 'Talwar' (sword) and 'Gada' (blunt mace) as alternatives, days after EC forbade both Sena factions to use the party name and symbol. The Uddhav-led faction on Sunday submitted 'Trishul', a 'Mashal' and 'Rising Sun' as symbol choices. The 40-headed Ravana froze the bow and arrow of Lord Ram, Uddhav said.

69.title: Private tourist buses in Pune being checked after Nashik accident
69.article_body: The Regional Transport Offices in the Pune district have launched a drive to check violations by private operators. This comes after a private tourist bus caught fire after colliding with a truck in Nashik. RTO officials said that they are also checking if the buses are carrying more passengers than allowed.

70.title: We'll build a statue of Messi outside Camp Nou: Barca Prez Laporta
70.article_body: Barcelona President Joan Laporta said the club has decided to build a statue of Lionel Messi outside Camp Nou. Messi joined PSG in 2021 after spending 21 years at Barcelona, having failed to renew his contract. "It's the saddest decision I've had to make," Laporta had said while discussing his exit. Messi is Barcelona's all-time top scorer with 672 goals.

71.title: DCW chief lists 10 MeToo complaints against Sajid Khan, seeks his removal from Bigg Boss
71.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women Chairperson Swati Maliwal has written to I&B Minister Anurag Thakur, seeking filmmaker Sajid Khan's removal from Bigg Boss 16 over multiple sexual harassment allegations against him. Maliwal listed 10 MeToo allegations by models, actresses and journalists against Sajid and wrote, "All these complaints show the disgusting mentality of Sajid."

72.title: Tom Cruise to become 1st actor to shoot in outer space: Report
72.article_body: Hollywood star Tom Cruise will reportedly be the first actor to shoot in outer space. "We have a great project in development with Cruise...Taking a rocket up to the Space Station and shooting," Universal Filmed Entertainment Group Chairman Donna Langley told BBC News. As per NY Post, the project will be directed by filmmaker Doug Liman.

73.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Terminal 2 of Bengaluru airport in November
73.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the newly constructed Terminal 2 of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport on November 10. "I invite all of you to participate in the event to make it a grand success," CM Basavaraj Bommai told BJP workers while addressing a party event. Terminal 2 is being built in two phases at a cost of ₹13,000 crore.

74.title: Delhi's garment shop owner returning from work shot dead, CCTVs being scanned
74.article_body: Two bike-borne men allegedly killed a garment shop owner in Delhi's Bindapur, reports said. The victim was returning from his shop along with his brother on a scooter when they were intercepted by the men. One of them shot the victim before the two ran away. Police said CCTV cameras in the area are being scanned as part of investigation.

75.title: Vicky's reaction to 'Phone Bhoot' trailer gave us much confidence: Katrina
75.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said Vicky Kaushal "absolutely loved" the trailer of her upcoming film 'Phone Bhoot' and it's his reaction that gave the team "much confidence" about the film. "He feels that there are so many fun elements in it and people would love it. That's our hope too," she added. 'Phone Bhoot' also stars Siddhant Chaturvedi and Ishaan Khatter.

76.title: Vegetarian crocodile that lived in Kerala temple pond for over 70 years dies
76.article_body: A vegetarian crocodile which had been living in a temple pond in Kerala's Kasaragod district for more than seven decades died on Sunday. Hundreds of devotees paid homage to the crocodile, named Babiya, when its body was placed on the premises of Sree Ananthapadmanabha Swamy Temple. The temple has no records that indicate how Babiya reached its pond.

77.title: Last rites of Mulayam Singh Yadav to be held tomorrow in Saifai at 3 pm
77.article_body: Last rites of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav will be held on Tuesday in Uttar Pradesh's Saifai at 3 pm, the party's official Twitter account posted on Monday. Yadav passed away on Monday after undergoing treatment at Gurugram's Medanta Hospital for several days. His son and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav confirmed the news of his death on Monday morning.

78.title: PM Modi expresses grief over Temsula Ao's demise, says her efforts noteworthy
78.article_body: PM Narendra Modi mourned the death of renowned Indian poet Temsula Ao and said that the Padma Shri recipient played an important role in popularising the Naga culture through her literary works. "Her efforts in the fields of education and culture were noteworthy. Condolences to her family and friends. May her soul rest in peace," the Prime Minister tweeted.

79.title: He devoted his life to UP, nation: Piyush Goyal on Mulayam Singh's demise
79.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said he devoted his life to Uttar Pradesh and the nation. "Netaji was dear to all…His demise is a great loss to the country," Goyal added. "His contributions to the nation will be remembered for many years to come," he added.

80.title: Mondrian's rare painting expected to fetch over ₹412 crore at auction
80.article_body: A painting by Dutch artist Piet Mondrian, titled 'Composition No. Il', is expected to fetch over ₹412 crore (over $50 million), according to auction house Sotheby's. "Works by Mondrian with a predominance of red are exceptionally rare," Sotheby's said. "It is also one of only three paintings to feature the dominant red square at the upper right," it added.

81.title: Pic of Ronaldo's unique celebration after his 700th club goal goes viral
81.article_body: A picture of Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo's unique celebration after he scored his 700th club goal during a Premier League match against Everton has gone viral. In the picture, Ronaldo and his teammate Antony can be seen with eyes closed and hands on their chests. Ronaldo's first Premier League goal of the season helped Manchester United beat Everton 2-1.

82.title: Delhi Police busts gangs cheating public using fake calls, websites
82.article_body: Delhi Police Cyber Crime Unit (IFSO) has busted three gangs and arrested 12 persons who used to allegedly cheat people by offering franchisees or services of leading firms using fake calls, websites and emails, among others. This comes after the Delhi High Court referred to the IFSO unit over matters regarding trademark and copyright violations relating to leading companies.

83.title: One faction doesn't want to leave CM's chair in Raj, other wants to grab it: Raje
83.article_body: Former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje on Sunday said while one faction in Congress government in the state does not want to leave the Chief Minister's “chair", the other is adamant to "grab it". Furthermore, she said, "People in the Congress government are least concerned about the public." She added that CM Ashok Gehlot is an expert in making false promises.

84.title: 7 lakes supplying drinking water to Mumbai 97.44% full
84.article_body: Seven lakes that supply drinking water to Mumbai are 97.44 per cent full and have 14,10,274 million litres (ML) of water stocked as on October 9. With this, the city now has water stocked for the next one year. The seven lakes that supply drinking water to Mumbai include Upper Vaitarna, Modak Sagar, Tansa, Middle Vaitarna, Bhatsa, Vihar and Tulsi.

85.title: Russia launched 75 missiles, says Ukraine as multiple blasts leave 5 dead
85.article_body: Several loud blasts, appearing to be coordinated attacks, were heard across different cities in Ukraine on Monday. The Ukrainian military's head said Russia launched at least 75 missiles on Monday. The explosions, which have killed at least five people and injured 12, came a day after Moscow blamed Ukraine for the explosion on a bridge linking Crimea to Russia.

86.title: Mulayam Singh Yadav was a big name in Indian politics: HP CM Jairam Thakur
86.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur has expressed his "deepest condolences" to the family members and supporters of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who passed away earlier in the day. "He was a big name in Indian politics. This is a great loss for the politics of the country," stated Thakur. Mulayam Singh passed away aged 82.

87.title: Man kills 2 men for confronting him for harassing woman in Pune neighbourhood
87.article_body: Pune Police are looking to catch a man for allegedly stabbing to death two men aged 24 and 27 after they confronted him about harassing a woman in their neighbourhood. Reports said that the accused had allegedly broken the glass of the woman's bathroom window on Saturday. When confronted by the victims about the same, the suspect stabbed them.

88.title: Cyberabad police shares video of person thanking staff amid rains
88.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Sunday shared a video of a person thanking its personnel for working amid heavy rains, saying, "These words give immense satisfaction, which can't be expressed in words." In the video, the person can be heard asking the traffic police personnel's name and saying, "Thank you very much sir for doing [a] great job in such rain."

89.title: In pics: Wrestler, teacher, 3-time UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's journey
89.article_body: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who served as Uttar Pradesh CM thrice and also served as Union Defence Minister, passed away on Monday aged 82. Yadav started his career as a teacher at Jain Inter College in Mainpuri district and also used to dabble in wrestling in his youth. He became an MLA for the first time at 27.

90.title: Jhunjhunwala once said 'I don't have money, I'll wash dishes': Mumbai pub's manager
90.article_body: Late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala once asked the waiter of a Mumbai pub to show him the way to kitchen when he was presented with the bill. Jhunjhunwala said 'I don't have so much money, I will wash dishes', Geoffrey's manager recalled. On another occasion, Jhunjhunwala forgot to pay the bill and sent 50% more than bill amount next day.

91.title: Girl recording video captures the moment missile hit across the street in Ukraine
91.article_body: A girl recording video in Ukrainian capital of Kyiv captured the moment a missile hit across the street. Ukraine has accused Russia of launching missile strikes across the country on Monday which have left several wounded and dead. Several pictures and videos from Ukraine showed buildings and vehicles on fire after the attack.

92.title: We don't have Messi sitting on the bench: PCB's Raja on criticism over selection
92.article_body: Reacting to criticism of their middle order in recent matches, PCB chief Ramiz Raja defended the team selection, stating that they have "limited options" and there's "no Lionel Messi sitting on the bench". "My philosophy in cricket is...we need consistency in selection and second we need to strengthen the skipper," stated Raja. "We haven't picked [any] worthless player," he added.

93.title: CBI arrests Hyderabad lobbyist in Delhi excise policy case
93.article_body: Another person has been arrested by the CBI in the Delhi excise policy case for allegedly lobbying for a South India-based businessman. The accused has been identified as Abhishek Boinpally, who is a resident of Hyderabad. The probe agency found him to be evading key questions. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has also been named in the case.

94.title: Suvendu Adhikari demands deployment of central forces in West Bengal
94.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Governor La Ganesan, demanding the urgent deployment of central forces after violence in Mominpur. "The Hindu community has come under attack on the eve of Lakshmi Puja...The onslaught has similarities to the Panchla violence, which happened in June in the Uluberia area of Howrah district," wrote Adhikari.

95.title: Mulayam Singh was true warrior associated with grassroots politics: Rahul
95.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi paid tributes to Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav on his demise. "Mulayam Singh Yadav was a true warrior associated with grassroots politics," Gandhi tweeted. "I express my deepest condolences to all the bereaved family members including Akhilesh Yadav," he added. Congress' Priyanka Gandhi also condoled Yadav's demise.

96.title: Hyd to get India's first residential sky deck project in Raidurgam
96.article_body: Hyderabad is going to get India's first sky deck residential project as a Telangana-based construction company announced the launch of its first such project in Raidurgam. As per the press release of Raghava Constructions, the project consists of three towers, each with 45 floors, and is spread across 7.38 acres. It is inspired by Singapore's Marina Bay, the company added.

97.title: India will have high-speed rail before US, it's a safe bet: Zoho's billionaire CEO
97.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu said it is a "safe bet" that India will have high-speed rail between major metros before US. Vembu was commenting on a report on the collapse of high-speed rail in California. Stating that US is losing will to govern, Vembu tweeted, "India has 25x lower per capita GDP but has the will to govern herself."

98.title: Bihar government announces 1-day state mourning on Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise
98.article_body: The Bihar government has announced a one-day state mourning on Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise on Monday. The SP founder passed away on Monday after undergoing treatment at Medanta Hospital in Gurugram for several days. His son and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav confirmed the news of his death on the party's Twitter page.

99.title: Russia trying to wipe us off: Ukraine as blasts reported across the country
99.article_body: Several explosions have been reported across Ukraine amid war with Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that many people have been left dead and wounded in the explosions, adding, "They (Russia) are trying to destroy us and wipe us off the face of the Earth." This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin called Crimean bridge blast a 'terrorist act'.

100.title: Hrithik to spend time with IAF officers to prep for 'Fighter': Report
100.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan will reportedly spend time with Air Force officers as a part of preparation for his role in 'Fighter'. As per a report, Hrithik is playing an Indian Air Force pilot in the film, which will also star Deepika Padukone. 'Fighter' is touted to be India's first aerial action film, which will release on September 28, 2023.

101.title: Mulayam Singh's death is saddening, we had familiar relations: Lalu
101.article_body: RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav condoled the demise of former UP CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. "Netaji is no more among us. Mulayam Singh Yadav had an important contribution in taking forward the socialist movement. We had familiar relations with him. The news of his demise is very saddening for us," he said.

102.title: 2 killed, 21 injured as lightning strikes them during football match in Odisha
102.article_body: At least two persons were killed and 21 others were injured when lightning struck them during a football match in Odisha's Sundargarh. Among the deceased was a football player while most of the injured were spectators. Police said that even though the sky was cloudy, there was no rain in the area when lightning struck the playground.

103.title: Srihari accuses IndiGo staff of bad behaviour, says 'Should we leave medals at venue?'
103.article_body: Indian swimmer Srihari Nataraj took to Twitter to criticise IndiGo staff for behaving badly with him and his teammates after they were returning from National Games. He stated they also charged hefty amount for excess baggage which included their medals. He wrote, "Honestly...the amount wasn't an issue...it's the way they treated [us]. Should we leave...medals we win back at...venue?"

104.title: AIMIM will run for all UP seats in future elections: Party's state chief
104.article_body: UP AIMIM President Shaukat Ali confirmed that the party will run for all seats in future Assembly elections. He also claimed that many SP leaders will join the AIMIM in the coming days. "People are coming towards AIMIM now. We are contesting in East UP, Purvanchal, Central UP and Bundelkhand," said Shaukat Ali.

105.title: Axis Bank awards work-from-anywhere staff higher performance ratings, promotions
105.article_body: Axis Bank has said that its employees working from anywhere were awarded higher performance ratings and promotions as compared to the overall staff population. The bank’s HR Head Rajkamal Vempati said, "In the WFA cohort, we see lower attrition and higher performance." Currently,  30% of its eligible workforce is working in alternate mode.

106.title: 'Indian 2' makers aiming for Dussehra or Diwali release in 2023: Report
106.article_body: The makers of 'Indian 2' are reportedly aiming to release the Kamal Haasan film on Dussehra or Diwali next year. As per a report, the team of the Shankar directorial will wrap up the project by March 2023. It is said to be a pan-Indian film, which will release in Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, Malayalam and Kannada.

107.title: N Korea confirms missile launches were 'tactical nuclear drills'
107.article_body: North Korea's recent missile launches were tactical nuclear drills which were guided by the country's leader Kim Jong-un, state media KCNA reported on Monday. It said that through the drills the "actual war capabilities" of the nuclear war forces which are "ready to hit and wipe out...set objects at any location and any time were displayed to the full".

108.title: Amit Shah reaches Medanta Hospital to pay last respects to Mulayam Singh, pics surface
108.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah visited Gurugram's Medanta Hospital where SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav died on Monday and paid his last respects. He met Yadav's family, including his son and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav, and expressed his condolences. Shah tweeted, "Due to the death of Mulayam Singh Yadav, a huge vacuum has emerged in Uttar Pradesh and national politics."

109.title: Wheelchair-bound Russian man with spinal issue called to fight in war; pic surfaces
109.article_body: A wheelchair-bound Russian has allegedly been called up to fight in war against Ukraine as part of the conscription drive. Oleg Vasiliev, who suffers from spinal muscular atrophy, has been told to report to his local draft office, a letter of which has also surfaced. Russian Paralympian Dmitry Ignatov was reportedly also called to an enlistment office.

110.title: Several explosions hit Ukraine's capital city Kyiv's centre: Mayor
110.article_body: Several explosions hit the centre of Ukraine's capital city Kyiv on Monday, the city's Mayor said. The city's emergency service's spokesperson told Associated Press that people have been killed and wounded. "What is Russia trying to hit? The national university? The park? Or...playground?" Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko said as she shared a picture of at least one of the explosions.

111.title: Helicopter service to Bengaluru airport to be launched today, details shared
111.article_body: Helicopter service from Bengaluru Airport to Bengaluru city will be launched today. BLADE India, the company that is handling the service, shared details of the initiative on its website, "You can now get to Bengaluru City Center in under 15 mins from BLADE helipad in BK Halli, Hennur, a 10 min car ride from the Airport terminal," the company said.

112.title: Irreparable loss for country: President Murmu on Mulayam Singh's demise
112.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, President Droupadi Murmu said that it's an irreparable loss for the country. "The achievements of Mulayam Singh Yadav Ji, who came from an ordinary environment, were extraordinary," President Murmu tweeted. "He was respected by people of all parties. My deepest condolences to his family members and supporters," she added.

113.title: Harbhajan was very supportive: Geeta Basra on her acting comeback
113.article_body: Geeta Basra said Harbhajan Singh "was very supportive" about her decision to make her acting comeback. "He thought it was great that I'm planning on going back to work and he told me that we'll find a way to take care of the kids," she said. Geeta will be seen in 'Notary', which marks her first film in six years.

114.title: 2 women pose as sex workers to stop man, rob him in Delhi; arrested
114.article_body: Two women, aged 25 and 28, were arrested after they allegedly assaulted and robbed a man of his gold ring in Delhi, police said. An officer said that the women posed as sex workers to stop the man, who was riding a motorcycle. "[The man] said while one woman grabbed his neck, the second one robbed...gold ring," the officer added.

115.title: 64-yr-old Mumbai man loses ₹17.80 lakh over nude video call
115.article_body: A 64-year-old Mumbai man lost ₹17.80 lakh in a 'sextortion' scam. The man received a nude video call from a woman who recorded the video with him in frame and later blackmailed him demanding money. On refusing to send money, he later received call from fraudster posing as Delhi Police officer who demanded money to save him from getting arrested.

116.title: Uddhav is nothing, Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray makes me important: Ex-Maha CM
116.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said, "Uddhav is nothing, it's Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray and this is what makes me important." Furthermore, he said, "I still remember Shiv Sena foundation day on June 19, 1966, when Sena was formed at Shivaji Park...Balasaheb used to take up issues of Marathi Manoos through Marmik weekly."

117.title: Congress to organise foot marches across Karnataka ahead of 2023 polls
117.article_body: The Congress party claimed that it would organise foot marches across Karnataka to reach out to all sections of society ahead of the 2023 Assembly polls. "We will undertake yatras in the state covering all three regions and every constituency and will reach out to people to highlight the failures of this 40% commission government," said Congress leader Randeep Surjewala.

118.title: Adani Group in talks to buy Jaiprakash's cement unit for ₹5,000 crore: Report
118.article_body: Adani Group is in advanced talks to buy debt-laden Jaiprakash Power Ventures' cement unit and other smaller assets for about ₹5,000 crore, Bloomberg reported. Notably, the Gautam Adani-led conglomerate recently bought Ambuja Cements and ACC from Switzerland's Holcim, becoming India's second-largest cement maker. The acquisition of Jaiprakash's cement unit will be made either by Ambuja or ACC.

119.title: Lift moves up as man tries to enter, almost cuts off his head in Russia; video surfaces
119.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing an elevator moving up as man tried to enter it and almost cutting off his head in Russia's Krasnodar. The video shows the man looking at his phone as he walks into the elevator, while the doors close around him. The man can be seen diving backwards to save himself.

120.title: That's 35 goals a season for 20 yrs: Lineker on Ronaldo's 700 club goals
120.article_body: Ex-England footballer Gary Lineker praised Ronaldo on scripting history by becoming the first player to score 700 club goals in top-level football, terming him as "incredible" on Twitter. "That is 35 goals a season for 20 years. Ridiculous!" added Lineker in his tweet. Ronaldo reached the milestone following his goal in a Premier League match against Everton.

121.title: Mulayam Singh Yadav was grassroots leader, played important role in UP: Rajnath Singh
121.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh paid tributes to Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav on his demise. He tweeted, "Shri Mulayam Singh Yadav ji was a grassroots leader who played a prominent role in the politics of Uttar Pradesh for many decades." He added, "Despite being in Opposition, Mulayam Singh ji had good relations with everyone."

122.title: Yuvraj Singh gets trolled for his 'Welcome to 700 club' tweet for Ronaldo
122.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has been trolled for his 'Welcome to 700 club' tweet for Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo. Yuvraj posted the tweet to congratulate Ronaldo on reaching 700 club goals. "He's only one in 700 club," a user wrote. "Which 700 club are you in...my good sir?" wrote another. "Welcome? He scored 700 goals...not runs," another tweet read.

123.title: More will come: Ten Hag on Ronaldo's 1st Premier League goal of the season
123.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo's first Premier League goal of the season on Sunday, Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag said, "He had to wait for it but I'm sure more goals will come." Notably, Ronaldo's first goal of the season is also his 700th club goal in top-level football. "That's really impressive when you score 700 goals," added Ten Hag.

124.title: Not many can hit sixes as early like I do: Ishan Kishan on not rotating strike
124.article_body: Talking about valuing six-hitting more than rotating strike, Ishan Kishan, who scored 93(84) in second ODI against South Africa, said, "Rotating strike is some players' strength, while some prefer hitting sixes." He added, "Not many can hit sixes as early like I do...if I can do my bit by hitting sixes...I don’t think of rotating that much," he added.

125.title: Road built as part of ₹19.5-cr project in B’luru caves in 4 months after inauguration
125.article_body: A service road built as a part of a ₹19.5-crore underpass in Bengaluru, caved in on Sunday, four months after its inauguration. While the repair was underway and may take a few more days, as per a report, the cave-in at the Kundalahalli underpass happened because a pipe under it broke and water seeped in over the last few days.

126.title: Jaishankar reaches Australia, shares pic of old Parliament house in Tiranga colours
126.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reached Australia on Monday and tweeted, "Arrived in Canberra to a Tiranga welcome. So happy to see the old Parliament house of Australia in our national colours." "We spoke about a lot of issues like economy, trade, education, defence and  clean energy," said Jaishankar in a joint presser with Australian Foreign Affairs Minister at Canberra.

127.title: Roadblocks to be put up only at night on Mumbai-B'luru Highway: Pune Police
127.article_body: The Pune Police said that roadblocks on Mumbai-Bengaluru Highway at Chandani Chowk in Pune will stay in place only during the night. The announcement comes after the 20 minutes traffic block done at 1 pm on Sunday led to massive traffic jam in the area. The block was done for rock blasting amid ongoing construction of the new bridge.

128.title: He was a very accessible person: Azmi after Mulayam Singh's demise
128.article_body: Mourning the passing away of veteran politician Mulayam Singh Yadav, actress Shabana Azmi said that he was "a very accessible person" and "a tall leader in national politics and UP governance". Shabana called Mulayam Singh Yadav "a son of the soil". Actor Anupam Kher also remembered meeting the late politician and said he "always used to meet cheerfully".

129.title: Singapore's life expectancy declines for the first time since 1957
129.article_body: Singapore's life expectancy declined by two months in 2021, marking the first time it has fallen since records were first kept in 1957. Officials from Department of Statistics attributed the decline to COVID-19, the fifth-most common cause of death in the city-state last year. Singapore's life expectancy at birth was 83.5 years in 2021, compared with 83.7 years in 2019.

130.title: NFT marketplace OpenSea CFO resigns after 10 months
130.article_body: NFT marketplace OpenSea CFO Brian Roberts has resigned ten months after assuming the position and will remain an advisor to the company. The firm's VP of finance Justin Jow will take on the role following Roberts' departure. Earlier this year, OpenSea fired 20% of its workforce to prepare "for the possibility of a prolonged downturn" in the digital asset market.

131.title: Rachakonda Police chief takes part in 'Pureathon'; pics surface
131.article_body: Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat on Sunday participated in a 'Pureathon', which was "a 2k/5k run, walk" organised by PURE NGO's Shyla Talluri to raise awareness about menstruation, police said. Police also shared pictures from the event. Moreover, Bhagwat appealed to people to install sanitary pad vending machines and incinerators at workplaces, hostels and public toilets for women.

132.title: End of an era in Indian politics: Shah on Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise
132.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that he remained active in politics for decades with his unique political skills. "His demise marks the end of an era in Indian politics," Shah tweeted. "During the Emergency, he raised his voice for the restoration of democracy," he added.

133.title: Tesla delivered record 83,135 China-made EVs in September
133.article_body: A report by China Passenger Car Association has revealed that Tesla delivered record 83,135 China-made electric vehicles in September, smashing a record set in June earlier. It is an 8% increase from August. "The record high sales of China-made Tesla cars showed electric vehicles have been leading the mobility trend," Tesla said.

134.title: Amazon to invest $975 million in European electric van, truck fleet
134.article_body: Amazon will invest nearly $975 million in electric vans, trucks and low-emission package hubs across Europe, over the next five years. It said the investment will help push its electric van fleet in Europe from 3,000 vehicles to more than 10,000 by 2025. It aims to buy over 1,500 electric heavy goods vehicles in the coming years.

135.title: Priyanka Gandhi condoles demise of ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav
135.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday condoled the demise of former UP CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. "His incomparable contribution to Indian politics as a former Uttar Pradesh CM, Defence Minister...and a strong advocate of social justice will always be remembered," Priyanka tweeted. Yadav passed away at Medanta Hospital in Haryana's Gurugram.

136.title: UP govt announces 3-day state mourning on Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise
136.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has announced a three-day state mourning on the demise of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath took to Twitter to make the announcement. The Chief Minister also said that Yadav's last rites will be performed with full state honours. The SP founder passed away on Monday.

137.title: Landslide amid heavy rains in Venezuela leaves 22 dead, 52 missing
137.article_body: At least 22 people died and 52 others are missing after a river overflowed causing a landslide in Venezuela's Las Tejerias amid heavy rains, officials said. The country's President Nicolás Maduro announced three days of national mourning in solidarity with the affected families from Sunday. "I never thought that something of this magnitude could happen," a citizen said.

138.title: Dhawan 'thanks' Keshav for opting to bat, says dew came in at right time
138.article_body: Team India stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan thanked South Africa's stand-in skipper Keshav Maharaj for opting to bat after winning the toss in their second ODI on Sunday. "Worked perfectly well for us...dew came in at the right time," said Dhawan jokingly after the game. India chased down SA's 278-run total in 45.5 overs to win by seven wickets.

139.title: Breaks my heart: Devoleena on Sajid's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16'
139.article_body: Television actress Devoleena Bhattacharjee said it breaks her heart to see Sajid Khan on national television and "trying to prove he is a hero". Sajid is one of the contestants in Salman Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16'. He was accused of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement. "It appears that you may do anything and enter 'Bigg Boss'," Devoleena added.

140.title: Ronaldo creates history, becomes 1st player to score 700 club goals in top-level football
140.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo on Sunday created history by becoming the first-ever player to score 700 club goals in top-level football. The 37-year-old reached the milestone by netting the winner in the 44th minute in a Premier League match against Everton. Ronaldo's 700 goals have come in 943 games for Sporting Lisbon, Manchester United, Real Madrid and Juventus.

141.title: England, Australia will trouble India in T20 WC 2022: Steve Harmison
141.article_body: Former England pacer Steve Harmison said he expects England and Australia to trouble India in the T20 World Cup 2022. "I don't think India are necessarily favourites or playing the best cricket," added Harmison. "England have a few players...[who] can have a huge influence on the big stage in pressure situations because they have done it before," he stated.

142.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Mulayam Singh Yadav, says 'He was a key soldier during Emergency'
142.article_body: PM Narendra Modi paid tributes to Mulayam Singh Yadav as the 82-year-old Samajwadi Party founder passed away on Monday. PM Modi said, "He was a key soldier for democracy during the Emergency." He also tweeted, "Shri Mulayam Singh Yadav Ji was a remarkable personality. He was widely admired as a humble and grounded leader who was sensitive to people's problems."

143.title: Apple's new Crash Detection feature alerts 911 when users ride rollercoasters: Report
143.article_body: Apple's new Crash Detection feature, which is supposed to alert authorities on detecting its user being in a car accident, is reportedly getting triggered by rollercoasters. As per a report, the feature is alerting 911 in the US when the user rides a rollercoaster. Apple rolled out the feature in iPhone 14, Watch Series 8, SE, and Ultra last month.

144.title: BJP should start preparing to be part of Opposition: Tharoor
144.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said BJP should start preparing to be a part of the Opposition ahead of the general elections in 2024. "Congress has run the country nicely, we have experienced people…We need to show our strength to re-win voters," Tharoor added. "Party...needs to be confident so voters may give us their trust," he stated.

145.title: Irreparable loss: Congress on Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise
145.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, the Congress party tweeted, "It is an irreparable loss for Indian politics." The tweet further read, "May God give him a place at his feet and give strength to his family and supporters to bear this loss." The three-time ex-UP CM had been in the hospital for several days.

146.title: India reports 2,424 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 28,079
146.article_body: India reported 2,424 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. A decline of 514 COVID-19 cases was recorded in a span of last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 28,079. The death toll climbed to 5,28,814 with 15 fatalities in last 24 hours.

147.title: Man shares pic of 'yellow paper' inside samosa served on train; IRCTC replies
147.article_body: A passenger travelling in Bandra bound Lucknow weekly express shared pictures of a samosa he bought on train and complained that he found a yellow paper inside it. "I salute IRCTC for the food [it's] serving," the man tweeted. IRCTC replied that the matter is being taken up, adding, "Sir, inconvenience regretted. Kindly share pnr and mobile no in DM."

148.title: 2 killed, 2 more rescued from debris as wall collapses at Mohali construction site
148.article_body: Two dead bodies were retrieved and two more persons were rescued from debris hours after a wall of an under-construction showroom at Mohali City Centre collapsed on Sunday evening. Earlier, one dead body and four persons were taken out of the wall's debris. The showroom is being constructed on the Mohali airport road.

149.title: 3 including 4-yr-old girl killed after building collapses near Delhi's Lahori Gate
149.article_body: Three people, including a four-year-old girl, were killed after a building collapsed near Delhi's Lahori Gate on Sunday. Officials said that efforts are on to locate and rescue those who could still be trapped under debris. A total of 11 people were reported injured after two more people were rescued on Monday morning.

150.title: 1 dead, 6 injured in shooting outside bar in US' Florida after fight breaks out
150.article_body: A shooting outside a bar in downtown Tampa, Florida, on early Sunday morning has left one dead and injured six others. According to police, a verbal altercation took place between two large groups inside the lounge. They were escorted outside, when a suspect retrieved a gun and fired multiple shots, injuring four adult males and two adult females, police added.

151.title: Delhi Police asks commuters to avoid road between Ashram chowk and Kilokri village
151.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory and warned commuters that there will be heavy traffic on both the carriageways between Ashram chowk and Kilokri village due to flyover construction work in the area. The construction work will continue till the first week of December, the traffic police added. The police further advised commuters to avoid this stretch.

152.title: Man stabbed to death in Delhi's Budh Bazar; 1 person arrested
152.article_body: A person was arrested for allegedly stabbing a man to death in Delhi's Budh Bazar, police said on Sunday. The incident occurred after the accused, Ankit, along with a few others stopped a motorcycle on which the deceased, Faraz, was travelling, police added. The suspects managed to escape from the scene and police have set up teams to catch them.

153.title: Putin accuses Ukraine of planning bridge blast, calls it 'terrorism'
153.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday accused Ukrainian special services of devising, carrying out and ordering the blast on a key bridge linking Russia and Crimea. "This is an act of terrorism aimed at destroying...important civilian infrastructure," he said. Security Council Deputy Chairman Dmitry Medvedev said that Russia "can only respond to this crime by directly killing terrorists".

154.title: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav passes away at 82
154.article_body: The founder of the Samajwadi Party (SP) Mulayam Singh Yadav has passed away aged 82 in Haryana's Gurugram. The three-time former UP CM was admitted to the ICU ward and reportedly put on a ventilator at Medanta Hospital last week after his health deteriorated. Yadav, who was also India's former Defence Minister, had been in the hospital for several days.

155.title: BJP creates tension between Hindus & Muslims: Owaisi
155.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday said, "BJP doesn't have anything to show except to create tension between Hindus and Muslims." Furthermore, Owaisi said, "I have full faith that the BJP will remain at number three in Telangana. They have no policy except to change the names." On Sunday, Owaisi criticised BJP for renaming Tipu Express.

156.title: Ravana seized bow and arrow of Lord Ram: Uddhav after EC freezes symbol
156.article_body: Days after the Election Commission froze the bow and arrow symbol of the Shiv Sena, former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that the 40-headed Ravana froze the bow and arrow of Lord Ram. "I believe in the judiciary. We will get justice...You stabbed your mother in the chest. Do not use Balasaheb's name," said Uddhav.

157.title: Urmila Matondkar to star in Marathi film 'Ti Me Navhech': Report
157.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar will reportedly be making her comeback to Marathi films after eight years with 'Ti Me Navhech'. As per a report, the film will see Urmila sharing screen space with actor Shreyas Talpade. The project will be helmed by theatre actor-director-writer Paritosh Painter. It is scheduled to go on floors in February 2023 in London.

158.title: Unfortunate that I missed on 100, but happy that we won: Ishan on 93(84)
158.article_body: Talking about his 93(84) in the second ODI against South Africa, Ishan Kishan said, "Unfortunately, I missed on century...[but] I'm just happy that [we] won." Ishan added, "I'll give my best and make [India] win again [in the final ODI]." Ishan and Shreyas added 161 runs for the third wicket as India chased down SA's 278-run total in 45.5 overs.

159.title: Expected pitch to get slower but it got better: Maharaj on 2nd ODI
159.article_body: South Africa stand-in captain Keshav Maharaj said they expected the pitch to get slower and lower, having opted to bat after winning the toss in the second ODI against India. "[However] it got easier to bat after the 30th over due to the...dew," added Maharaj. "We didn't expect the dew to play such a big part," he stated.

160.title: Noida, Greater Noida authorities plan e-bike service for commuters
160.article_body: The Noida and Greater Noida authorities are planning to start electric bike service soon on rent at all metro stations and other busy public areas. "Many expert agencies are showing interest in taking the e-bike project," a senior official said. The authority has decided to procure 350 e-bikes that commuters can rent at a cost of ₹2 per minute.

161.title: Kanye West's Twitter account locked a day after his return over anti-Semitic tweet
161.article_body: Twitter has locked and restricted rapper Kanye West's account for violating site policies and deleted a tweet which invoked anti-Jewish stereotypes. The action was taken just one day after West returned to the social media platform for the first time in nearly two years. Earlier, Instagram removed content from West's account and placed restrictions on it following repeated policy violations.

162.title: Rupee hits new record low of 82.67 against US dollar
162.article_body: The Indian rupee touched a new record low on Monday after having breached the 82-mark against the US dollar for the first time ever on Friday. On Monday, the rupee opened at 82.67 against the dollar as compared to Friday's close of 82.33. Notably, the rupee has lost over 10% of its value this year.

163.title: Pune RTO to start special drive against private tourist buses
163.article_body: Pune RTO has now decided to start a special drive to check all tourist bus operations ahead of Diwali. It will form special squads to keep tabs on passenger seating capacity, fares, etc. "Our appeal to the public is to travel safely and register a complaint with the RTO if they face any issue," an RTO officer said.

164.title: Schools to be shut in Noida, Ghaziabad today due to heavy rainfall
164.article_body: Schools will remain shut in Noida and Ghaziabad today due to heavy rainfall. Schools have also been shut in Kanpur, Aligarh, Agra, Lucknow, Hapur and Meerut. The decision will be applicable to students up to class 12. "All the principals and headmasters should ensure compliance with the order," District School Inspector Dharamveer Singh said.

165.title: Beaten by teacher for failing test, 12-yr-old Noida boy dies in hospital
165.article_body: A 12-year-old class five student died while undergoing treatment after he was allegedly beaten by his teacher for failing a test in Noida. However, police said that the student was unwell that day and therefore, the exact reason for death has not been ascertained. The teacher was allegedly present with the family at the hospital until the boy died.

166.title: Many BJP workers secretly support AAP in Gujarat: Kejriwal
166.article_body: Many BJP leaders and workers in Gujarat secretly support AAP and want to see the defeat of their own party in the upcoming Assembly elections, Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Sunday. "After 27 years, people want hope because they got nothing but corruption and misgovernance in all these years," Kejriwal said at a rally.

167.title: Katrina may look innocent, but she’s a prankster: Siddhant Chaturvedi
167.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said his 'Phone Bhoot' co-star Katrina Kaif "might look innocent, but she's a prankster". Siddhant also called Katrina "one of the most hardworking actresses" he's worked with. "It was fun working with her. She was very loving. Got to learn a lot from her," he said. 'Phone Bhoot' also stars Ishaan Khatter.

168.title: It’s off the table: Dwayne Johnson on 2024 US Presidential run
168.article_body: Actor Dwayne Johnson has confirmed that the idea of running for the 2024 US Presidential elections is "off the table". Johnson shared that he's been approached by "most influential" political personalities "asking and supporting" him to run for President. But while he's grateful for the opportunity, Dwayne said, "I'm not a politician nor have I ever aspired to be one."

169.title: No desire to be involved in wars: Musk after his proposals on Ukraine-Russia, China-Taiwan
169.article_body: After suggesting a possible peace deal to end the war between Russia and Ukraine and to diffuse China-Taiwan tensions, the world’s richest person Elon Musk remarked, "I have no desire to become involved in wars." Responding to a Twitter user, Musk added, "But it is safe to say that all bets are off if the nukes start flying."

170.title: What father earned, Uddhav lost in minutes: NCP's Khadse on Sena symbol freeze
170.article_body: Referring to the freezing of Shiv Sena's name and symbol by the Election Commission, NCP leader Eknath Khadse said, "What the father had earned with a lot of difficulties is lost by the son in minutes in [a] political fight." Khadse added, "Uddhav Thackeray came to power with this symbol but everything is lost now in the fight."

171.title: Lena Headey, known for playing Cersei in 'Game of Thrones', marries for 3rd time
171.article_body: Actress Lena Headey, best known for playing Cersei Lannister in 'Game of Thrones', has married actor Marc Menchaca in a private ceremony in Italy. This is Lena's third wedding as she was previously married to musician Peter Paul Loughran and director Dan Cadan. GoT actors Peter Dinklage, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Emilia Clarke, Sophie Turner and Conleth Hill attended the wedding.

172.title: Sushmita Sen was my first choice: Shreegauri Sawant on her biopic
172.article_body: Transgender activist Shreegauri Sawant said Sushmita Sen was her first choice to play her character in her upcoming biopic 'Taali'. "One should think about how challenging the role will be for a woman with such stature," she said. Shreegauri added that Sushmita has shown courage in taking up the role, which "comes with a lot of taboos".

173.title: 3 people steal food, ₹4,000 from Pune food delivery executive; probe on
173.article_body: Pune Police are looking to catch three persons who allegedly stole food, ₹4,000 cash and valuables from a food delivery executive on Friday night. The victim said that the accused also assaulted him and beat him up with a sharp weapon. Police are collecting the CCTV evidence in the case. A case has also been registered.

174.title: 2 teens who went for picnic drown in check dam in Ranga Reddy
174.article_body: Two teenagers drowned in a check dam in Ranga Reddy's Pedda Amberpet after they went for a picnic with their friends on Sunday. The incident occurred when four members of the group were drowning after they decided to enter the water and some people who were present managed to rescue two of them, according to reports. A case was filed.

175.title: Structural, fire audit ordered in Mumbai's post-mortem centres, mortuaries
175.article_body: Police surgeon Dr Kapil Patil ordered structural, fire and electrical audits of five post-mortem centres in Mumbai. The step was taken after Patil, during his inspection, found that the centres were in bad condition. As per Patil, the waiting room was stuffed with construction material, there was no arrangement for drinking water and lack of forensic experts in the centres.
