350.title: Rahul will be seen in new avatar after Bharat Jodo Yatra: Digvijaya
350.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Sunday said that Rahul Gandhi will be seen in a new avatar after the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra. Singh said that Gandhi has become a symbol of "Bharat Jodo", adding that people are very impressed that he's walking all the way during the yatra. Notably, Gandhi is spearheading the yatra that will end in J&K.

351.title: Be happy that people care: Ramiz Raja recalls advice to Babar over his criticism
351.article_body: Recalling a conversation with Pakistan captain Babar Azam about facing constant criticism, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said he has told Babar to take the feedback positively. "I say to Babar, 'Be happy that cricket isn't like any other sport in Pakistan where people don't care about them'," revealed Raja. "When people are engaged, they will form opinions," he added.

352.title: Swastika shares pic with WB CM, says 'Wished her Shubho Bijoya & got chocolates'
352.article_body: Actress Swastika Mukherjee met West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee at the Durga Puja Carnival on Red Road in Kolkata. The actress took to Twitter to share a picture where she was seen interacting with Banerjee. Swastika wrote, "Have always admired her indomitable spirit and fiery personality. Wished her Shubho Bijoya and got chocolates."

353.title: Pune hospital performs rare procedure on newborn with heart disease
353.article_body: A newborn with complex congenital heart disease underwent a rare hybrid procedure known as patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) stenting at Pune's Army Institute of Cardio-Thoracic Sciences. The baby had pulmonary atresia in which the pulmonary valve is absent. The team that performed the procedure included cardiologists, a cardio-thoracic surgeon and a cardiac anaesthetist.

354.title: Newborn girl found in garbage dump in Delhi's Vasant Kunj is stable: Police
354.article_body: Delhi Police on Sunday said that the newborn girl who was found in a garbage dump and admitted to a private hospital in Vasant Kunj is in stable condition. "The baby was drenched due to rain, extremely weak and in a hypothermic state with the umbilical cord attached," said Dr Rahul Nagpal, Director and HOD, Pediatrics, Fortis Hospital, Vasant Kunj.

355.title: Workers fall from scaffolding at Delhi airport; 2 dead, 6 injured
355.article_body: Two labourers died and six others were injured after they fell from the scaffolding at a construction site in Terminal 1 of Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport. While one worker was declared brought dead, the other died during treatment, DCP (IGI Airport) Tanu Sharma said. Sharma added that a case has been filed against the contractor in the matter.

356.title: Uddhav submits 'Rising Sun & Trishul' as alternatives after EC freezes Sena symbol
356.article_body: A day after the EC froze the name and symbol of Shiv Sena, Uddhav Thackeray submitted a list of three names and symbols, reports said. The Uddhav-led faction chose 'Shiv Sena Balasaheb Thackeray', 'Shiv Sena Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray' and 'Shiv Sena Prabodhankar Thackeray' as party names while choosing 'Trishul', a 'Mashal' and 'Rising Sun' as symbols.

357.title: Miss your noise, it's too quiet: Neetu on late husband Rishi Kapoor
357.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram and shared a picture of her late husband, actor Rishi Kapoor. Along with the picture, Neetu wrote, "Miss your noise, it's too quiet." Several celebrities, including Anushka Sharma and Maniesh Paul, reacted to the post. The veteran actor passed away on April 30, 2020, at 67.

358.title: Tipu was barbarian: Malviya on Owaisi's remark over renaming of Tipu Express
358.article_body: BJP's Amit Malviya reacted to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi’s remark over renaming of Tipu Express. "BJP will never be able to erase Tipu's legacy," Owaisi had said. Following his reaction, Malviya tweeted, "BJP doesn't want to erase the legacy of Tipu. On the contrary, we want his true legacy to be known to the people. Tipu was a barbarian."

359.title: Rahul Gandhi should think before speaking against Savarkar: Shiv Sena
359.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Manisha Kayande condemned Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's remark against VD Savarkar and asked him to think before making such statements. "We prohibit Rahul Gandhi's statement and the Shiv Sena's opinion towards Savarkar is the same and it will never change," said Manisha. Earlier, Rahul had claimed that Savarkar used to work for the Britishers.

360.title: Hurricane Julia makes landfall in Nicaragua; 6,000 evacuated
360.article_body: Hurricane Julia made landfall in Nicaragua early Sunday, hours after lashing Colombia's San Andres island in a close pass-by. Nearly 6,000 people were moved to safer locations by Nicaraguan authorities ahead of Julia's arrival. Julia started off as a tropical storm on Saturday but developed into a Category 1 hurricane shortly before passing through the close vicinity of San Andres.

361.title: MK Stalin elected unopposed as DMK President for second time
361.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin was unanimously elected as DMK President at the party's general council meeting held in Chennai on Sunday. Party leaders Durai Murugan and TR Baalu were unanimously elected as General Secretary and Treasurer, respectively, with all three leaders being elected to their posts for the second time.

362.title: Google shutting down its Assistant Driving Mode on Nov 21: Report
362.article_body: Google is shutting down its Maps integration in Assistant Driving Mode Dashboard on November 21, according to a 9to5Google report. The Dashboard features media suggestions and quick access to audio controls, along with shortcuts for calling and texting. The car-optimised experience in Google Maps for Android, which Google also refers to as Driving Mode, will remain, the report said.

363.title: Boy rapes 4-yr-old neighbour after offering her candies in Gurugram
363.article_body: A 15-year-old boy allegedly raped his four-year-old neighbour after offering her candies in Gurugram on Tuesday evening. The victim was alone at her home when the boy allegedly raped her and urinated on her. The girl is being treated at a hospital for a stomach infection, while the boy has been apprehended and sent to a correctional home in Faridabad.

364.title: Delhi sees 2nd highest rainfall since 2007, temp margin drops to record low: IMD
364.article_body: The national capital received the second highest rainfall since 2007 in the last 24 hours till 8.30 am, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Sunday. Due to continuous rainfall, the difference between minimum temperature (20.8 degrees Celsius) on Friday and maximum temperature (23.4 degrees Celsius) on Saturday was 2.6 degrees Celsius - the lowest since 1969, IMD officials said.

365.title: Eng destroyed us in T20 WC 2021, it was a turning point for Aus: Wade
365.article_body: Discussing Australia's defeat against England in T20 World Cup 2021 where England chased down a target of 126 in 11.4 overs, wicketkeeper Matthew Wade said, "They destroyed us." "It was...a turning point for the way we...[play] T20s," added Wade. "We've got seven batters...We've got...power and...depth [in] batting that...you need to go with [while facing] a team like England," he stated.

366.title: Assange's supporters form human chain in UK over extradition
366.article_body: Supporters of WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange formed a human chain outside the UK Parliament after the government approved his extradition to the US to face criminal charges. Assange's wife Stella said that the extradition is a "stain" on the UK and US President Joe Biden-led administration. Pictures and a video of the human chain have surfaced online.

367.title: Never seen a liar like Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal: BJP's CR Paatil
367.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for his "Kansa" remark and called him a liar. He also asked him to think before making such statements. "We have never seen a liar like Arvind Kejriwal. Despite being a CM, he peddles lies. He called people of Gujarat 'Kansa' & then he's seeking votes from them," said Paatil.

368.title: Ex-senator briefly held hostage during breakout bid in Philippines
368.article_body: An undertrial Philippine politician, Leila de Lima, was briefly held hostage during an attempted prison break in the Manila capital region, police said on Sunday. De Lima, a former senator, emerged unhurt from the incident, as per authorities. The three prisoners who staged the failed breakout were shot dead by police. One police officer was stabbed by the inmates.

369.title: Neetu Kapoor shares Ranbir's pics from 'Brahmastra' look test showing his 6-pack abs
369.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to share pictures of her son Ranbir Kapoor from 'Brahmastra' look test showing his six-pack abs. The pictures were originally shared by Ranbir's trainer and lifestyle coach Kunal Gir. "This one is for all Ranbir Kapoor fans. These are unseen pics taken during a look test in Bulgaria," he wrote in the caption.

370.title: Domino's responds after man shared pics of glass shards in pizza, says 'No anomaly found'
370.article_body: After a man in Mumbai shared pictures of glass shards that he allegedly found in his Domino's pizza, the company said that they will collect samples from the customer. Domino's said, "We immediately contacted the customer...Our quality team has also conducted a thorough investigation...and no anomaly was found...We follow a strict no-glass policy in our kitchen and operation area."

371.title: RSS chief's call to end caste system must be implemented: Pawar
371.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar threw his weight behind RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's call to end the age-old caste system that leads to discrimination within society. "The concept of untouchability was never part of religious text or practice," Bhagwat said, adding that the concepts of 'varna' and 'jati' had no place for discrimination, even in the past.

372.title: B'luru techie makes hoax bomb threats to Vidhana Soudha; arrested
372.article_body: A 41-year-old unemployed software engineer was arrested on Friday for making three hoax bomb calls to Karnataka Chief Secretary's office in Bengaluru's Vidhana Soudha. Police used sniffer dogs to search the Chief Secretary's office after Prashanth Kumar called at 2:06 pm on Friday and claimed he'd planted bombs. Kumar was arrested hours later from his home in Bengaluru's Hebbagodi.

373.title: England record highest-ever T20I total by a visiting team in Australia
373.article_body: England on Sunday recorded the highest-ever T20I total by a visiting team in Australia. England registered 208/6 in the first T20I in Perth to set the record. The previous record was jointly held by India and England, who had recorded 200/3 and 200/9 in Sydney and Hobart in 2016 and 2014, respectively. Alex Hales top-scored for England today with 84(51).

374.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part Two' to release in Summer 2023: Report
374.article_body: Trade analyst Taran Adarsh shared that the makers of 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part Two' are "targeting a Summer 2023 release". He further informed that unlike 'Baahubali 2' and 'KGF 2', the sequel of the Mani Ratnam directorial was shot simultaneously with the first part. Recently, the makers announced that 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' crossed ₹300 crore worldwide at the box office.

375.title: 'Defectors platter' belongs to Shinde faction for serving BJP: Sibal
375.article_body: While reacting to the EC's decision to freeze the 'bow and arrow' symbol of the Shiv Sena, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the 'defectors platter' belongs to Eknath Shinde's faction for serving the BJP. EC freezing the Shiv Sena symbol amounts to "freezing democracy", he said, adding that the symbol belongs to the faction led by Uddhav Thackeray.

376.title: 4.4kg gold hidden in clothes, bags & hairband seized at Hyd airport
376.article_body: Customs officials have seized about 4.4 kg gold in separate incidents at Hyderabad airport. In first incident, three passengers tried to smuggle gold by concealing it in undergarments and chains. Two passengers who hid gold in their check-in baggage were intercepted in the second incident, while in the last incident, a passenger concealed gold in a hairband and dress parts.

377.title: Zomato CEO delivers orders once in 3 months, nobody recognised him: Investor
377.article_body: Zomato's Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal wears a red t-shirt and spends a day delivering orders himself at least once a quarter on a motorcycle, Naukri.com owner and Zomato's early investor Sanjeev Bikhchandani has revealed. "Deepinder tells me that thus far nobody has recognised him," Bikhchandani added. Not only Goyal but all senior managers at Zomato do the same.

378.title: Mulayam Singh Yadav quite critical, on life-saving drugs: Medanta Hospital
378.article_body: Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital on Sunday said former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav’s condition is quite critical today and he is on life-saving drugs. "He is being treated in the ICU of the hospital by a comprehensive team of specialists," Dr Sanjeev Gupta, Medical Director, Medanta Hospital, Gurugram, said. He has been undergoing treatment at the hospital since August 22.

379.title: Muslims using condoms most: Owaisi on RSS chief's 'population' remark
379.article_body: Following RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's 'population imbalance' remark, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "Don't take tension. Muslim population is not rising. In fact, it's on the decline." "Do you know who is...using condoms the most? [Muslims] are doing," Owaisi added. Notably, Bhagwat had called for a population control policy, saying that religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored.

380.title: Part of road collapses near under-construction building in Greater Noida
380.article_body: A portion of a road near an under-construction building in Greater Noida caved in on Sunday after incessant rain lashed parts of NCR for past two days. No injuries have been reported after the collapse. A video of the collapse showed a cave-in a few metres long. Three bulldozers and five dumpers have been deployed to fill the caved-in section.

381.title: Man snatches phone from woman travelling on scooty in Gurugram
381.article_body: A man allegedly snatched a woman's mobile phone while she was riding pillion on a scooty in  Gurugram. The suspect approached the woman, Bhawna Sharma, and fled after snatching her iPhone from her hands when the latter was returning home in Sushant Lok Phase-I from Ambience Mall, police said. Notably, an FIR was registered at DLF Phase-III Police Station.

382.title: What about Amitabh, Madhuri?: BJP on Pawar's Muslim-Bollywood remark
382.article_body: Responding to NCP chief Sharad Pawar's remark that Muslim minorities have made the biggest contribution to Bollywood, BJP asked whether Pawar can deny contributions made by Amitabh Bachchan and Madhuri Dixit. "So terrorists have no religion, but art and cinema have a religion, Pawar saheb?" the BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla asked.

383.title: Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone's 'Pathaan' to get a sequel: Reports
383.article_body: The makers of 'Pathaan' are reportedly working on a sequel to the film. "The team of Pathaan has begun writing...sequel to the film," a source was quoted as saying. The upcoming action film, starring Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone and John Abraham, is set to release in theatres on January 25, 2023. It is directed by Siddharth Anand.

384.title: Mumbai Police releases traffic advisory for Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions
384.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police have made arrangements to ensure smooth commute amid Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions, which will be taken out in parts of the city today. As per the advisory, traffic restrictions are imposed on certain areas like Byculla, Pydhonie, Dongri, Azad Maidan, among others. The restrictions on travel would be effective from 2 pm to the time the processions conclude.

385.title: Thanks for being the wind beneath my wings: Pujara to wife on her b'day
385.article_body: Team India batter Cheteshwar Pujara took to Twitter to wish his wife Puja on her birthday, terming her as the "wind beneath" his wings. "You don't just make me happy, you make me proud. My affection towards you grows with each passing year," added Pujara in his tweet. "Thank you for being you!" stated Pujara in his tweet.

386.title: Karnataka to witness heavy rainfall till October 11: IMD
386.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted rainfall across Karnataka till October 11. The forecast says that heavy and thunderous rainfall is expected in coastal Karnataka, north interior and south interior districts of the state. A yellow alert has also been issued for several north Karnataka districts, including Belagavi and Raichur.

387.title: Man arrested in B'luru for drug peddling, over 300 bottles of cough syrup seized
387.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a man for allegedly peddling the Alluring Narcotic drug ESKUF (cough syrup) and seized 356 bottles of the cough syrup and a two-wheeler from the accused. The ESKUF cough syrup can only be sold with a proper medical prescription. The drug is reportedly known to be misused by mixing it with banned narcotic substances.

388.title: PM Narendra Modi wishes people on Valmiki Jayanti
388.article_body: PM Modi extended greetings on Valmiki Jayanti and also shared a video. The day marks the birth anniversary of Maharishi Valmiki who is credited with writing the original Ramayana. The UP government has decided to celebrate his anniversary in a grand manner across the state, including the continuous recital of the Ramayana at all temples of Lord Ram and Hanuman.

389.title: PM Modi responds to man's 'must visit Kashmir' tweet, shares pic of his visit to Srinagar
389.article_body: PM Narendra Modi recently responded to a tweet of a man who shared pictures from his recent trip to Kashmir and urged that people 'must visit'. Sharing a picture from his visit to the valley, PM Modi wrote, "Excellent. I'm also tempted to share a picture from my visit to Srinagar in 2019."

390.title: Amit Shah offers prayers at Kamakhya temple in Guwahati
390.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah offered prayers at the Kamakhya temple in Assam's Guwahati on Sunday during his three-day visit to the Northeast. He was accompanied by Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. "Feeling extremely blessed after praying at the Maa Kamakhya Devi Temple in Guwahati," Shah tweeted. CM Sarma tweeted a video of Union Home Minister’s visit to the temple.

391.title: Businesses can remain open 24×7 in Delhi, over 300 applications cleared: Report
391.article_body: Businesses like restaurants, transport services, BPOs and online delivery services which apply for exemptions will be allowed to operate 24×7 in Delhi starting next week, an official told The Indian Express. Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena recently approved the proposal to exempt 314 such places to operate all day long, some of them pending since 2016, the official added.

392.title: I don't think about it: Rizwan on contest with Surya for no.1 T20I batter's spot
392.article_body: Pakistan opener Muhammad Rizwan, on being asked about competition with India batter Suryakumar Yadav for the top spot in the ICC T20I batters' rankings, said, "I don't think much about it." He added, "Suryakumar is a good player and the way he plays I really enjoy it." Rizwan is currently the top-ranked batter in T20Is, while Suryakumar is placed second.

393.title: WhatsApp's clone app may be spying on Indian users: Report
393.article_body: 'GB WhatsApp', a clone of the Meta-owned messaging app WhatsApp, may be spying on Indian users and reading their chats, according to a report by ESET, the maker of NOD32 antivirus. The cloned third-party version of WhatsApp isn't available on Google Play. Hence, the versions of the clone app available on various download websites are riddled with malware, ESET added.

394.title: Boat capsizes in Nigeria amid heavy flooding; 10 dead, 60 missing
394.article_body: At least 10 people have died and 60 others are missing after a boat capsized in Nigeria's Anambra state amid heavy flooding, officials said on Saturday. The country's National Emergency Management Agency zonal coordinator said that around 85 people were on board the boat. At least 15 people have been rescued, Anambra's emergency management agency head said.

395.title: UK's trade minister fired after being seen touching a young man's thigh in a bar
395.article_body: UK's trade minister Conor Burns was removed from his position after he was allegedly seen touching a young man's thigh in a bar at the Tory Party conference. While he was asked to leave the government "with immediate effect", Burns has denied any wrongdoing. Notably, Burns was a long-time ally of former Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

396.title: Raavan looks like Khilji in 'Adipurush', are you making fun?: Mukesh
396.article_body: 'Shaktimaan' actor Mukesh Khanna said Saif Ali Khan's Raavan in 'Adipurush' looks like a Khilji ruler. He added, "[Saif] has been given a Mughal look. Are you making fun?" Mukesh further "warned" the "intellectual and rich people" to not use their money to change "rituals, religion and epic". Saif's look was trolled on Twitter after the 'Adipurush' teaser was released.

397.title: Govt starts probe as US fines Oracle over ₹3.3 cr bribe to railway officials: Report
397.article_body: The Ministry of Railways has reportedly initiated a probe against Oracle after the US SEC fined the company for paying about $400,000 (₹3.3 crore) in bribes to railway officials in 2019. "Oracle India sales employees...used an excessive discount scheme in connection with a transaction with a transportation company, a majority of which was owned by the Indian...Railways," the SEC said.

398.title: My best wishes for this endeavour: PM Modi on Puneeth's 'Gandhada Gudi'
398.article_body: PM Narendra Modi sent his best wishes for late actor Puneeth Rajkumar's upcoming film 'GG - Gandhada Gudi', which he called "a tribute to Mother Nature". Puneeth's wife Ashwini tweeted that the actor "cherished" his interactions with Modi. In response, Modi wrote that Puneeth "lives in the hearts of millions around the world" and was "blessed with unparalleled talent".

399.title: Tharoor’s appeal goes beyond party, Cong needs urgent reformist thinking: Karti
399.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram backed the party’s Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor, saying the latter’s pragmatic modernism coupled with his appeal beyond the party, is crucial to fight BJP’s divisive politics. "Status quo and business as usual won’t help our party. There’s an urgent need for reformist thinking in our party," Karti Chidambaram added.

400.title: Sonali's family receives 2 letters alleging ₹10-cr deal in murder case, naming politicians
400.article_body: Sonali Phogat's family members have said that they received two letters from an anonymous sender, with her brother-in-law Aman Poonia stating that both the letters should be investigated. The first letter, which was received a month ago, has alleged that a deal of ₹10 crore was made in the murder case. Meanwhile, the other letter mentioned names of political leaders.

401.title: Max Verstappen wins F1 world championship for 2nd year in a row
401.article_body: Red Bull's 25-year-old Dutch driver Max Verstappen on Sunday won the Japanese Grand Prix to clinch Formula One 2022 world championship with four races left in the season. Verstappen has now won the world championship for the second year in a row. Verstappen is leading the 2022 driver standings with 366 points, followed by his teammate Sergio Perez (253 points).

402.title: NATO should do more to protect itself from Russia: German minister
402.article_body: German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said on Saturday that North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) should "do more" to protect itself from Russia, adding that no one knows "how far Putin's delusions of grandeur can go". Lambrecht made the remarks during a visit to Lithuania. She further said that Russia's threat of nuclear weapons shows that its authorities have "no scruples".
